text:
1) create custom Modules
2) create Landing Page Templates
3) create custom Email Modules
4) Setup CMS Hub Settings / change Settings

Hello everyone!
We currently have 4 domains on a single HubSpot account.
What we are trying to achieve is to create pieces of content that we can reuse on all 4 websites and every time we make changes to a particular piece of content, this should affect all the pages that use it.
For example: we have 4 similar pages on 4 different domains. They should share the same body and have a different Header, Footer and form at the bottom of the page.
Is it doable and can we keep the drag and drop functionality on the pieces of content?

Thank you in advance!
Use a global module for the body?

Hello! I'm not quite sure where this belongs but my client wants to have cookie options on one page which also shows what cookie preferences you have selected at the moment, is this possible? If not what might be a better solution?

Hello!

I’m working on some advanced logics for an email module contents and I’m stuck on getting users lists within email.
I’ve tried to use `request_contact.list_memberships` and it works great for email preview and web-version, but it returns null in sent email.

Whether it’s possible to get list membership with crm objects? Or is there any other way to check the membership on email module?

Thanks!
This is only available via smart content in email <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/cos-general/add-smart-content-to-your-website-pages-landing-pages-and-emails>
Hi Joe! So it’s impossible to code it, right?

Hello Everyone:wave:, we are migrating a blog from Wordpress to HubSpot but we are not sure of what to do with the Wordpress blog, should we just unpublish it or should we delete it? We ask this because we want to avoid having duplicate content.
Thank you
when you will point out your domain to HubSpot server after migrating content search engine will crawl blog from HubSpot next time…do you get my point ??

Thank you <@UNWHHSWHJ>! so should we unpublish and redirect?, would this be enough to not classify as duplicate content?
I  have also been told to set up the Wordpress to no-index but do you think we need to do that or just redirect domain to HubSpot would be enough?
Sorry to ask that much :grimacing:
Yes email does not support more advanced HubL at the moment

This will cause us to lose flexibility and content creators will not be able to add or remove items to the module. What we are searching for is a group of content with dnd area that can be edited globally. So that everyone could add or remove new modules to this reusable group and also can edit the modules content. Is it possible?

Thanks,
Oh yeah, you can use a Global Partial and then add it to a template. Then you can edit that partial like a global module, but you get a whole dnd area
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/CLJJXGTC0/p1619035199171300>
Does anybody have insight on what this new site tree view is? I see its currently in beta. Is it purely for viewing your site structure, or can more be done with it?
You can do a lot of what you can do in the normal page listing:
Creating a child page in there is pretty awesome as well
Cool. Can you tie into like a navigation menu? Say you wanted to create a site map page that shows all pages on your site?
I dont believe that is possible but I can pass that along internally to the group running this beta
as i can see you got your answer in thread of <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/CF540P856/p1619016811057800|this message>, let me know if you have more questions :slightly_smiling_face:
